Description: Shoulder sherd (mended from two fragments) of Aeolian grey ware pottery krater; handle join on left; exterior: dark grey slip and inscription with traces of added red paint.
Curator's comments: Gardner (188, 47) suggests British Museum 1888,0601.703 is from the same vessel, and includes this text in a general comment that such vessels probably originated from Mytilene or Lesbos because their inscriptions were most probably dedications made by Mytileneans or Lesbians; however, he further remarks (1888, 67) that the dialect does not appear to be Lesbian Aeolic because of the dative plural ending in -ois, not -oisi, while -ois is the accusative. Red paint applied to the inscription can also be observed in a few other cases of grey ware at Naukratis.

While the remark about the dative plural is true of literary texts, one may suggest that it may not apply in the strongly Ionic environment of Naukratis or indeed in everyday Aeolic prose. If 1888,0601.703 does belong we may note that the whole would contain the typically Aeolic katheke, not anetheke.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 67, no. 840, pl. XXII, no. 840)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 691, no. 489, pl. 22.7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.011)
